intro: Salaxis leeana, commonly known as the Leeana salaxis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Salaxis leeana is typically found in rocky outcrops and coastal areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
